About Me I am Dragos Hont, a resilient and systems-oriented learner based in Bucharest, Romania. This e-portfolio documents my academic journey through the MSc Artificial Intelligence programme at the University of Essex Online.
My academic and professional interests include:
Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning – workflow mining, specification-driven development, and applied AI Structured Workflows – modular, checklist-driven approaches to technical and everyday tasks Responsible AI & Governance – ethical considerations and best practices in AI deployment Culinary & Creative Experimentation – applying iterative refinement and modular thinking beyond computing This portfolio reflects my commitment to rigorous, reproducible work and my adaptability across technical and practical domains.
Background For over 15 years, I’ve been a hands-on software engineering leader, building robust systems across finance, banking, energy, compliance, and security. Those years in the code, solving diverse problems in complex domains, taught me the fundamentals of system design, the importance of clean architecture, and the discipline of seeing projects through from conception to production release.
My focus has evolved from solving problems with code to solving them through people – empowering developers, creating environments where they can do their best work, and building teams that are more than the sum of their parts.
Beyond Technology When I’m not exploring AI and machine learning concepts, I’m planning the next adventure with my family. We love to create things together, whether it’s a piece of software to plan our next trip or experimenting with new approaches to everyday challenges.
Let’s Connect I’m always open to connecting with fellow learners, researchers, and tech enthusiasts. Feel free to reach out through any of the channels above.
summary: About Me I am Dragos Hont, a resilient and systems-oriented learner based in Bucharest, Romania. This e-portfolio documents my academic journey through the MSc Artificial Intelligence programme at the University of Essex Online.

Overview This project explores the intersection of AI, workflow mining, and specification-driven development. The goal is to develop methods for automatically extracting, analyzing, and optimizing workflows in complex software systems.
Objectives Apply machine learning techniques to workflow analysis Develop specification-driven approaches to system design Create reproducible, modular solutions for workflow optimization Investigate ethical considerations in AI-driven automation Status Currently in the research and planning phase as part of the MSc AI programme at the University of Essex Online.
summary: Research project exploring specification-driven development and workflow mining techniques in AI systems.
title: AI-Driven Workflow Mining

content:
Introduction This work examines how structured, modular approaches from software engineering can enhance AI development processes. Drawing on 15+ years of experience building robust systems and ongoing academic study in artificial intelligence, it proposes a framework for specification-driven AI development.
Key Concepts Modular Thinking Breaking complex AI systems into manageable, testable components that can be developed, validated, and deployed independently.
Checklist-Driven Development Applying systematic verification approaches to ensure quality, reproducibility, and ethical considerations throughout the AI development lifecycle.
Workflow Mining Leveraging machine learning to analyze and optimize development workflows, identifying patterns and bottlenecks in the AI delivery pipeline.
Future Directions This research will continue as part of the MSc AI programme, with planned applications in:
MLOps and model deployment AI governance and responsible AI frameworks Requirements engineering for AI systems Automated workflow analysis and optimization
summary: Exploring structured workflows and specification-driven development in AI systems.
title: Structured Approaches to AI Development
